channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Economic uncertainty can trigger recession — and your spending could hold the key
item.description: Economists look for signs that a recession may be approaching by monitoring consumer confidence and business sentiment — two indicators of uncertainty.
item.content:encoded:
Economists look for signs that a recession may be approaching by monitoring consumer confidence and business sentiment — two indicators of uncertainty.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Stock markets fall over tariff concerns. And, fentanyl deaths drop in every state
item.description: The stock market fell yesterday as investors worry that Trump's tariffs will slow the economy and possibly lead the U.S. into a recession. And, fatal fentanyl overdoses are down in every U.S. state.
item.content:encoded:
The stock market fell yesterday as investors worry that Trump's tariffs will slow the economy and possibly lead the U.S. into a recession. And, fatal fentanyl overdoses are down in every U.S. state.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: What to know about this week's 'blood worm moon' total lunar eclipse
item.description: This total lunar eclipse — the first in three years — will feature a "blood worm moon," so named for the reddish hue of its glow and the time of year it's occurring.
item.content:encoded:
This total lunar eclipse — the first in three years — will feature a "blood worm moon," so named for the reddish hue of its glow and the time of year it's occurring.

(Image credit: Ringo H.W. Chiu)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: How reliable is the government's economic data? Under Trump, there are real concerns
item.description: The disbanding of committees that consulted on government data — and comments from a senior official about changing how GDP is calculated — are raising alarm about the reliability of government data.
item.content:encoded:
The disbanding of committees that consulted on government data — and comments from a senior official about changing how GDP is calculated — are raising alarm about the reliability of government data.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Former Navy SEALs say they're making marine conservation cool
item.description: A group called Force Blue, which does conservation work across the country, is providing what they call "mission therapy" to veterans who miss the camaraderie and the sense of purpose of service.
item.content:encoded:
A group called Force Blue, which does conservation work across the country, is providing what they call "mission therapy" to veterans who miss the camaraderie and the sense of purpose of service.

(Image credit: Blake Jones for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: The government already knows a lot about you. DOGE is trying to access all of it
item.description: Agencies from Social Security to the IRS store sensitive data on millions of Americans. Here's what the government knows about us – and what's at risk as DOGE seeks access to the data.
item.content:encoded:
Agencies from Social Security to the IRS store sensitive data on millions of Americans. Here's what the government knows about us – and what's at risk as DOGE seeks access to the data.

(Image credit: Greggory DiSalvo/iStock/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: RFK says most vaccine advisers have conflicts of interest. A report shows they don't
item.description: The Health Secretary's assertion inaccurately characterizes the 2009 government report he cites, according to an NPR review and interviews with former committee members.
item.content:encoded:
The Health Secretary's assertion inaccurately characterizes the 2009 government report he cites, according to an NPR review and interviews with former committee members.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: How meme coins rose from obscurity to their current popularity
item.description: Meme coins are popular these days with everyone from c-list celebrities to President Trump. Planet Money has the story of how they went from a one-off joke to a speculative frenzy worth billions.
item.content:encoded: Meme coins are popular these days with everyone from c-list celebrities to President Trump. Planet Money has the story of how they went from a one-off joke to a speculative frenzy worth billions.
item.dc:creator: Alexi Horowitz-Ghazi

item.title: Drought-stricken Algeria plans to import 1 million sheep ahead of Islam's Eid Al-Adha
item.description: North Africa is enduring its seventh consecutive year of extreme heat and below-average rainfall. The drought has shrunk harvests and driven up the price of animal feed needed to raise livestock.
item.content:encoded:
North Africa is enduring its seventh consecutive year of extreme heat and below-average rainfall. The drought has shrunk harvests and driven up the price of animal feed needed to raise livestock.

(Image credit: Anis Belghoul)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Former Philippine leader Duterte arrested on an ICC warrant over drug killings
item.description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte was arrested Tuesday on order of the International Criminal Court in connection with a case of crime against humanity, the Philippine government said.
item.content:encoded:
Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte was arrested Tuesday on order of the International Criminal Court in connection with a case of crime against humanity, the Philippine government said.

(Image credit: Aaron Favila)
item.dc:creator: Adam Hancock
